definition: to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
addiction/craving

sentences.english: Good coffee, really hit the spot.
On a hot day there's nothing I like more than a cold orange juice.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得，大热天没有比来杯橘子汁更过瘾的了。
交换总机看起来比较过瘾。

sentences.english: Today, knocking the 4 experiments, good quickly, my fingers are flying.
sentences.chinese: 今天敲了4次实验，好过瘾，自己的手指头都飞了。

sentences.english: You can get really loopy here and sing to your heart's content.
sentences.chinese: 你可以唱的很疯，唱到你过瘾为止。

sentences.english: Oil sizzling in the pan sounds exciting to savour.
sentences.chinese: 锅中滋滋作响的油听起来可尝个过瘾。

sentences.english: Hot chocolate in winter is the best.
sentences.chinese: 在冬天喝热巧克力最过瘾。

sentences.english: Well, I didn't win it, but I still fun at the pub.
sentences.chinese: 我没有得任何奖，但仍然觉得过得“过瘾”。

sentences.english: Felt like doing more chores, Andileah went to arrange the things on the small side table.
sentences.chinese: 似乎干得还不过瘾，舒蕊又去收拾茶几上的东西。

sentences.english: It feels really good to feed fish in water.
sentences.chinese: 到水下去喂鱼的感觉太过瘾了。

sentences.english: Of course I was only on the kaleidoscopes.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我只是看着过瘾的。

sentences.english: Nowhere on earth can one so quickly overdose on breathtaking gorgeousness.
sentences.chinese: 地球上还没有其他一处地方能让人如此大呼过瘾的。

sentences.english: yeah, just picked it up quick and had a blast.
sentences.chinese: 是，我就这么开始攀岩，玩得很过瘾。

sentences.english: Rollerblades is fun, but comes out as "not so good" on safety.
sentences.chinese: 踩滑轮挺过瘾的，但从安全角度来说，不太好。

sentences.english: I like Luna Brothers' Girls, it's great as watching a film.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢卢娜兄弟的《女孩》，就像看电影一样过瘾。

definition: energetic/exciting/of interest
lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
bright/clear/crisp/open/frank/straightforward/to feel well/fine/pleasurable/invigorating/to deviate
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to one's heart's content (idiom)
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
(neologism) (of movies, songs etc) affecting/touching/moving/(of a person, esp. a woman) charming/cool
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
delighted/to one's heart's content/straightforward/also pr. [tong4 kuai5]
to feast one's eyes
to be playful/to be fond of one's fun
amusing/fun/interesting
to feel great/blissful/to be in bliss
full of life/violent/brave/fresh (of seafood)
wonderful/marvelous/brilliant
hot and numbing
